chunks.en: What is true love like?
The thing is, I was chatting with a female lawyer I know who works independently last night. She said she's encountered several divorced male clients.

They are all middle-aged men in their 40s who met a young woman and discovered true love. They feel that their previous marriage lacked love and was just based on compatibility. Now they want to divorce and accept a clean break.

Everyone is advising the client that he is being irrational.

The male client's gist: You don't understand what true love is. Before meeting the second woman, I didn't think true love existed in the world.

What people like is a collection of certain traits. In fact, anyone is acceptable as long as they are within this 'framework'.

I also asked the girl what she thought: This matter had a big impact on her, causing her to hesitate about getting engaged to a man she met through a blind date because she realized that she was the same way. Within this 'framework,' she would find someone who is best for her.
As for love, maybe there is, but it's hard to say in the long run.
Just wants to fuck a young pussy.
What true love is, but just an excuse for cheating and liking the new and loathing the old.
@Cheons Just wants to fuck her because she's pretty, wants to fuck every one he sees, but maybe after you fuck her and pull out your dick, you won't be sad when you leave this person.

True love, I think, is just that the two people have been together for so long that they are reluctant to leave each other and can't leave each other. They mentally suggest to themselves that they love her.

True love can also be multiple people. After being with multiple people for a long time, it's not just about fucking them, you want to live with them, get married, and have children. This requires financial support.
(True love from a male perspective) Wants to have sex with them, but is also willing to be with them even without having sex.
(True love from a female perspective) Wants to be with them, and is willing to have sex with them.
Ordinary people can get married when they meet one of these conditions.
"What people like is a collection of certain traits. In fact, anyone is acceptable as long as they are within this 'framework'." I have always thought this way.
Asked, all are true love.
Is it just me who falls in love with every attractive person I see?
Philosophically speaking, the feeling of true love is that the other person's position in your heart is greater than or equal to your consciousness's acceptance capacity.

For example, the door of consciousness is as big as your house's door. Ordinary things just enter and exit your consciousness by sharing this space, but the presence of that 'she' is too strong, blocking this door, which is like being unable to see Mount Tai because a leaf is covering your eyes.
There is only one solution: After getting close and spending time together, you realize that the other person is nothing special.

In fact, this kind of 'pursuit of true love' should be done when you are young. Discover that your fantasies are too fantastical, come out of your own dreams, and then go to choose a suitable partner.

Another type of couple who are together because they are 'suitable' probably didn't have the courage to do anything to 'pursue true love' when they were young. The negative effects of the lack of courage accumulate until middle age, and then they can't be suppressed and suddenly burst out, which is really self-inflicted, paying the price for their cowardice when they were young.
It is true that people like people with specific collections, but this is only the first step of liking.

From the first step of liking, to mutual liking, to marriage, to truly being suitable (irreplaceable), to walking hand in hand to the end of life, this process cannot be achieved by just a few concepts in a specific set.
True love does not require marriage and has nothing to do with divorce.

A distant relative of mine, an elder, a woman, spent half a century together with a married man (who had been separated for a long time, they met after the separation). The other party did not divorce, and they naturally did not marry.

The original family was far away, and there was no quarreling. It was defaulted until the man died. The inheritance went to the wife and children in the distance, and my distant relative did not get a penny (of course, she also saved some extramarital money during their time together, but not much).
When I heard about this, I sighed that this was an emotion I couldn't understand. Whether it was true love, I couldn't judge.
@Lowlife Can you be a little more refined? ğŸ¥²ğŸ˜…

Judge by actions, not intentions. Legally, cheating cannot directly lead to divorce and won't result in much more money, so if the man didn't cheat during the marriage or even left with nothing, I don't think there's a big problem.
As for whether it's true love or just lusting after a young body, there's not much difference.

Everyone's concerns are actually over-sanctifying marriage as a social behavior. This is the result of the high cost and cumbersome process of getting married in China, but in reality, true love shouldn't be a consideration of cost.
Is there true love between the emperor and his concubines?
Leaves with nothing? And then finds out the true love disappeared.
Men don't have much true love, true love is when a woman sees you and gets wet.
@superliy Then you are lucky.
Generally, people invest more true love in their first love, and the ending and plot are quite cliche.
I personally think that men with a sense of morality will not cheat casually after marriage.
It's good to marry an ordinary wife and live an ordinary life, it saves you trouble.
@alax234 Serotonin only lasts for 3-18 months, so breaking up and finding a new one every 3-18 months is just the same as always searching for true love.

@thinkm Well, haven't there been a lot of young girls accompanying people to play billiards in billiard halls in the past two years, and the fees are not low either. I asked my friends who like to play what they are looking for, and they replied: Because they are young, even if they can't get it up in middle age, it's still a very happy thing to be surrounded by a group of young girls.
True love cannot be understood until you encounter it, just like two-dimensional creatures can never understand three-dimensional space-time.
Moreover, true love is atomic, either it exists, or it doesn't.
There is no such thing as 50% true love.
I think it's purely based on luck, most people will never encounter true love in their lifetime.
Therefore, there is no point in discussing this publicly.
Praise true love, and also praise responsible general love relationships.
I haven't spoken on v2 for a long time, so I'll post a rant today.
I used to believe in true love, tmd. At that time, I didn't care at all that the other party was a fat person who was 175cm and 230 pounds.

When they gave me a cold shoulder, I thought the pressure of graduate school was too great. I bought him all kinds of delicious food and drinks, bought him games, assembled a computer, and even when he told me that he was short of money to buy a wedding house, I directly transferred it to him without even asking him to write an IOU.
As a result, after he graduated from graduate school and entered the system, the first thing he did after getting ashore was to cut me down.
I was still stupid enough to think it was because I wasn't good to him that he wanted to break up.
As a result, he blocked me and didn't pay back a penny of the money he owed.
True love is the piglet and roasted abalone of Nanjing Normal University
In the beginning, for those first few years it's definitely all sweet words, stuck together like glue, and full of passion.
Then it's you in me and me in you.
I haven't experienced what comes after that. Some people say companionship + habit becomes nature + dependence, but I haven't experienced it yet.
